context_of_use: This use case allows customers and managers to manage orders effectively within the system.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: wants to purchase items easily
manager: wants to ensure orders are processed efficiently
description: This use case enables customers to add products to their cart, checkout, track their orders, and allows managers to approve orders.
preconditions: Manager is authorized to approve orders.
postconditions: Customer successfully adds products to cart.
assumptions: The customer has an account and is logged in.
The manager has the necessary permissions to approve orders.
requirements_met: The system shall allow customers to add products to their cart.
The system shall allow customers to checkout using multiple payment methods.
The system shall allow customers to track their orders.
The system shall allow managers to approve orders.
outstanding_issues: Clarification needed on the types of payment methods supported.
main_flow: 1. Customer adds products to cart → System updates cart with selected products.
2. Customer proceeds to checkout → System displays checkout options.
3. Customer selects payment method and confirms order → System processes payment and confirms order.
4. Customer requests order tracking → System provides order status.
5. Manager reviews pending orders → System displays orders awaiting approval.
6. Manager approves order → System updates order status to approved.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 2): If the customer wants to change the payment method, they can select a different option and return to Step 3.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 3): If payment fails, the system notifies the customer and prompts them to retry or select a different payment method.
